author: UK News
title: Flood alerts issued for England | Express & Star
text: Flood alerts issued for England Across the weekend, England and Wales will be largely dry with sunny spells. Flood alerts have been issued in England after heavy showers and thunderstorms on Thursday, the Met Office said. Torrential downpours battered the UK on Thursday as almost a month’s worth of rain fell in an hour in Greater London, according to the weather forecaster. A flood alert has been issued on Friday for Rivers Eden and Eden Brook in the south east of England, and Upper River Loddon in the south west. Across the weekend, England and Wales will be largely dry with sunny spells, with highs of 25C in southern England on Saturday and Sunday, and lows of 20C further north. Met Office spokesman Stephen Dixon said: “What’s replacing the previous weather regime is a transition back to more changeable conditions for the UK, albeit still retaining some level of sunshine at times.” On Saturday, showers will continue in the north west, though for much of England and Wales, it will be a dry day with sunny spells. Sunday is likely to be increasingly wet for western Scotland and Northern Ireland, and some places in south-west Scotland may see an excess of 70mm of rain from Sunday into Monday, the Met Office said. Sunday will be a fine day for England and Wales, with sunny spells and the odd light shower in parts of northern England. Next week is predicted to be changeable, with bright, dry and sunny periods at times, interrupted by some more unsettled interludes through the week. Rain will move from west to east gradually, and those further south east will generally see less frequent rain. Mr Dixon said: “An Environment Agency rain gauge at New Addington, Greater London, recorded 53.4mm of rain as part of yesterday’s thundery outbreaks.” Average total rainfall for August in the same area is 56mm, the forecaster said. “However, such is the nature of these localised thundery outbreaks, some private rain gauges that are not a part of the official Met Office network recorded higher totals through the day in parts of southern and central England,” Mr Dixon added.

author: Grupo Zócalo
title: Mujer en Michigan torturó a su suegra anciana mientras su novio se encontraba de vacaciones – Periódico Zócalo | Noticias de Saltillo, Torreón, Piedras Negras, Monclova, Acuña
text:
Estados Unidos.- Un mujer en Michigan se enfrenta a una cadena perpetua por alegadamente torturar a su suegra discapacitada mientras su novio se encontraba de vacaciones.
Laura Catherine Tisdelle, de 41 años, fue acusada de tortura, abuso en primer grado de un adulto vulnerable , detención ilegal y violencia doméstica en tercer grado.
Este miércoles, la jueza Kimberly Wiegand ordenó juicio en contra de la acusada en la Corte de Distrito del condado Macomb.
La ley de Michigan establece que una persona convicta de tortura enfrentará una sentencia máxima de prisión de por vida en una institución estatal. Por los cargos restantes, Tisdelle podría tener que cumplir unos 35 años adicionales tras la rejas de resultar culpable.
Los hechos por los que Tisdelle fue acusada se reportaron en junio pasado .
Alegadamente, la mujer ató a la víctima de 80 años a una cama y la golpeó severamente . La anciana fue hallada inconsciente y entre desechos corporales.
La oficina de la fiscalía del condado indicó en un comunicado que, el 21 de junio, el novio de Tisdelle e hijo de la víctima regresó a su vivienda tras un viaje de cinco días con sus hijos. En el lugar, descubrió a su madre con las manos atadas, sometida a una cama, golpeada, y entre orín y excremento .
El reporte de The Macomb Daily detalla que Tisdelle utilizó un cordón para amarrar las manos de la paciente a la cama .
“ El novio de la acusada dejó a su madre bajo su cuidado, y cuando regresó a la casa del viaje, la acusada estaba intoxicada y su madre no respondía”, dijo Wiegand según reseñó el rotativo.
La víctima tuvo que ser trasladada a un hospital donde fue admitida en la unidad de cuidado intensivo en condición crítica .
Durante la travesía del hombre, Tisdelle era la única persona a cargo de su madre.
“ La tortura y el abuso alegadamente infligido hacia a una anciana indefensa es un testamento sombrío a los rincones más oscuros de nuestra sociedad”, indico Peter J. Lucido, fiscal del condado Macomb, en declaraciones tras el arresto.
“ Es mi deber solemne procesar estos actos atroces. Nosotros nos vamos a asegurar que la voz de la víctima sea escuchada, su dolor reconocido, y que su perpetradora rinda cuentas”, añadió.
Tisdelle ha estado detenida desde su arresto en junio . La jueza ordenó que fuera sometida a evaluaciones por abuso de sustancias controladas, así como de salud mental .
Se suponía que Tisdelle acudiera a una audiencia ante Wiegand este miércoles para una evaluación preliminar del caso, pero la acusada renunció a la misma, por lo que la jueza refirió el caso a la corte de circuito para juicio.
Con información de El Diario NY

author: Lewis Clarke
title: Explore coastal wonders with National Trust's sea life survey - Devon Live
text: From Hartland to Hurlstone Point the National Trust is carrying out sea life surveys across 100 miles of coast between the 26 July - 4 August, with events open to the public. Join rangers and volunteers to take part in surveys at Heddon’s Mouth, Mortehoe, and Hurlstone Point, along with rockpool rambles and a silent disco beach clean being held at Woolacombe. This is an opportunity for families, nature enthusiasts, and anyone looking to learn more about identifying sea life species to get involved and help collect important data about UK sea life. Amy U’Ren, volunteering & community officer for North Devon National Trust, said: “After the success of last year’s surveys we are excited to be able to welcome the public to get involved again and have fun while learning about surveying and coastal environments.” Taking place during the National Whale and Dolphin Watch run by the Sea Watch Foundation, results from these surveys will be submitted to the organisation, helping to create a ‘snapshot’ of what can be seen in UK coastal waters. Volunteers are essential for the work carried out by the National Trust and these events offer a chance for people to learn more about volunteering across North Devon and Exmoor and the type of roles involved. Amy said: “We are always looking for people who love nature and the outdoors to join our friendly, welcoming volunteering community. If you have ever wanted to give volunteering a try, come along to one of these events and meet the team.” To find out more about the sea life survey events and how to get involved visit: What's on in North Devon l Devon | National Trust . Survey events and Woolacombe silent disco beach clean are free drop-in sessions. Booking is essential for rockpool rambles which take place all through the summer and costs £5 per ticket. If you are interested in further volunteering opportunities, please contact [northdevon@nationaltrust.org.uk](mailto:northdevon@nationaltrust.org.uk).

author: Jess Balzer
title: Burnaby studio makes holiday toy donation to B.C. charity
text:
A Burnaby animation company is bringing joy to children this holiday season.
Arcana Studio recently announced a donation of thousands of toys and books to Big Brothers Big Sisters Langley.
The donation included a collection of beloved children's books including Randolph the Reindeer and The Littlest Tardigrade, as well as Pixies plush toys.
"Each title and toy was carefully chosen to spark imagination and encourage young readers to explore the world of literature and creativity," a news release said.
Randolph the Reindeer tells the story of an underdog reindeer who proves that courage and determination can make all the difference.
The Littlest Tardigrade introduces children to the microscopic marvels of the natural world, featuring an inspiring story of resilience and discovery while Pixies plush toys bring to life enchanting creatures from Arcana's magical worlds.
“We believe that stories have the power to change lives,” Arcanda Studio Founder and CEO Sean Patrick O'Reilly said in a news release.
“This holiday season, we wanted to give back by providing these wonderful books and toys to children who are part of the Big Brothers Big Sisters program. It’s our way of spreading joy and fostering a love of learning and adventure in the hearts of young readers.”
Big Brother Big Sisters of Langley will distribute the toys and books to children and family in need during the holidays.
"We would like to extend our heartfelt thanks to Arcana Studio for their generous donation of books to Big Brothers Big Sisters of Langley, which will have a lasting impact on the youth we serve and help foster a love of reading and learning," Executive Director Roslyn Henderson added.
